tweet:
My joint statement with @RepJimmyPanetta on the #GilroyShooting:  https://lofgren.house.gov/joint-statement-gilroy … 

Please share these important resources with members of the community affected by this tragedy. pic.twitter.com/j8mRpF0zQk
Standing in solidarity with @GilroyPD at their press conference to update our community on the #Gilroy Shooting.  Watch here. https://twitter.com/NewsHour/status/1155886284612743169 …
I am heartbroken over the innocent lives lost and outraged that this violence has happened in our community at a time when families and neighbors were enjoying the annual #GilroyGarlicFestival .

TY first responders for helping the victims at the festival shooting. If looking for a loved one, please go to the reunification center at Gavilan College at parking lot B. https://twitter.com/GilroyPD/status/1155671693450330112 …

We know the Trump campaign shared internal polling data with Russians in 2016. We don’t know who requested that it be shared with them or why. DOJ must give Congress the full, unredacted Mueller report & underlying evidence so we can get these answers. https://tinyurl.com/y62qd8jf

Thanks @Slate for highlighting this key piece of information from my questioning of Former Special Counsel Mueller. The Russians actively worked toward a Trump victory in 2016 and even discussed campaign strategy with Trump’s campaign manager Paul Manafort. #MuellerHearings pic.twitter.com/niFq6oMqzI

Mueller told me and my @HouseJudiciary colleagues that Russia attacked our democracy in a “systemic and sweeping fashion” to help the Trump campaign, and the campaign welcomed their help. @realDonaldTrump, this interference should ALWAYS be reported to the FBI. #MuellerHearings pic.twitter.com/fIp8eTPqR6

Some of my colleagues like Rep. @Ilhan Omar receive death threats multiple times a week. When @realDonaldTrump invokes racist rhetoric against elected officials, he emboldens bigots to act on their hateful beliefs. This needs to stop.” https://twitter.com/HouseAdm_Dems/status/1151515123569319936 …

My @HouseJudiciary colleagues and I just passed @CongressmanRuiz's bill to improve conditions of migrant families in CBP custody by ensuring that their most basic needs are met, including clean water, healthy food, and adequate shelter. Children cannot keep dying in U.S. custody. pic.twitter.com/mFQjEFkWSK

Today the House passed a resolution I cosponsored condemning President Trump’s bigoted and reprehensible remarks against my colleagues. When the President of the United States invokes racist tropes to ignite fear and divide the nation, Congress must speak out as loudly as we can.

Yesterday the Assistant DHS Inspector General testified before my subcommittee about dangerous conditions migrant families are subjected to in Border Patrol custody. Her report was disturbing, but not surprising, to me & my @HouseJudiciary colleagues who visited CBP facilities. pic.twitter.com/6QlAQE8HW9

The Trump Administration must answer for its unlawful and cruel immigration policies. That’s why I’m holding an oversight hearing today on Border Patrol’s inhumane detainment of migrant families. It’s abusive to children and must be stopped. Watch NOW at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZMr45t6oqsg …

POTUS is an ignorant bigot trying to delegitimize duly elected Members of Congress based on ethnicity and gender. President Trump shames our country. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/14/us/politics/trump-twitter-squad-congress.amp.html …

Today, @HouseJudiciary authorized subpoenas so Congress can hold the Trump Administration accountable for unconscionable policies at the border and its potential crimes related to the Mueller Report. Simply put, the American public deserves answers. https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/house-panel-poised-to-subpoena-kushner-sessions-and-10-others-with-ties-to-trump/2019/07/11/01585dc2-a3cf-11e9-b8c8-75dae2607e60_story.html?fbclid=IwAR3i2muT45XDNqG5Nj_za6nuhRbs5vFCPKxNCgWg-rTJzuaAOfRBgkfbknw&utm_term=.2cc9888b9631 …

It was a pleasure to meet with San Jose constituents in DC for the annual BPSOS Vietnam Human Rights Advocacy Day and discuss improving both U.S.-Vietnam relations as well as human rights conditions in Vietnam. pic.twitter.com/rBa3wvkSnm

The House passed @RepKenBuck’s and my bipartisan bill to make our visa system fairer for skilled immigrants legally working in the US. #HR1044 has 200+ Dem and 100+ GOP cosponsors. If @POTUS is serious about merit-based legal immigration, he should help usher this bill into law. pic.twitter.com/exFT9W9BhZ
